slots.title: Obama puts a Jack Lew in charge of Treasury

stories.title: Obama puts a trusted man at the Treasury
stories.description: President Barack Obama nominates White House chief of staff Jack Lew to be his next Treasury Secretary, a widely-expected move.

slots.title: US Senate rejects House budget bill

stories.title: Senate rejects Republican 'cut, cap and balance' bill
stories.description: The Democratic-led US Senate rejects a "cut, cap and balance" bill passed by the Republican-led House, as a debt limit deadline nears.

stories.title: What does 'government shutdown' mean?
stories.description: Talk of a looming government shutdown is once again ricocheting around Washington. But what does that mean in practice? The BBC's Katie Connolly reports.

stories.title: US shutdown: Washington's truly dangerous cliffhanger
stories.description: Hysterics over the US fiscal crisis threaten not only the world economy but the basic principle of democracy, the BBC's Mark Mardell says.

stories.title: Sick children lose lifeline as NIH closes due to US shutdown
stories.description: The budget dispute that has closed down large parts of the US government has meant some vital drug trials have been put on hold.

slots.title: Democrats reject proposed US House fiscal plan

stories.title: US Senate and House push parallel debt limit plans
stories.description: The two chambers of the US Congress pursue parallel plans to extend the debt limit and reopen the federal government, just days ahead of a deadline.

stories.title: US debt ceiling: Senate rushes to draft fiscal plan
stories.description: The US Senate is expected to take up a bipartisan bill to raise the debt limit and reopen the US government, just a day before the US risks default.

stories.title: US shutdown: Senate reaches fiscal deal
stories.description: Republican and Democrat leaders of the US Senate have struck a cross-party deal to reopen the government and raise the nation's debt limit.

stories.title: US reaches debt limit deal
stories.description: Republican and Democrat leaders of the US Senate have reached a deal to raise the US debt limit and end a partial government shutdown.

stories.title: US Debt Ceiling Crisis: A Listicle Guide To Why Washington Came So Close To Financial Catastrophe
stories.description:
Finally, after 16 days of shutdown and having come within a day of breaching the debt ceiling,  Republicans and Democrats appear to have reached a deal to reopen the US government and avoid default . 
To outside observers, the past three weeks may have been somewhat baffling  a perplexing cocktail of Tea Partiers, Ted Cruz, Obamacare, furloughed workers and debt.  
Here is a simple guide to how and why Washington came so close to pushing the world back into financial chaos.

stories.title: US debt ceiling: Senate passes US budget deal
stories.description: The US Senate overwhelmingly passes a bill to reopen the government and raise the federal debt limit, with hours to spare before the nation risks default.

stories.title: Relief in Asia over US debt deal
stories.description: Asian investors express relief after US politicians make a breakthrough in talks to end the government shutdown and raise the debt limit.

stories.title: Shares in Europe dip after US debt deal
stories.description: Shares in Europe fall slightly despite US politicians agreeing a deal that ends the partial government shutdown and avoids a debt default.

stories.title: Congress passes eleventh hour deal to avert US debt crisis
stories.description: The bipartisan deal left Republicans little to show for the epic political drama that had threatened to rattle the world economy

stories.title: World press see US debt deal as 'temporary truce'
stories.description: World newspapers say the US Congress has managed to avoid a "financial catastrophe" by raising the federal debt limit, but feel the crisis is far from over.

stories.title: Relief as US approves debt deal
stories.description: There is international relief at a US deal to reopen the government and raise the debt limit, averting the risk of potential default.
